course.subject: PSYCH
course.course_title: Introduction to Psychology: The Frontiers of Psychological Inquiry

notes.note: Register for either lecture 1 or 2 (whichever has room). Both sections are the same.

course.subject: PSYCH
course.course_title: Introduction to Psychology: The Frontiers of Psychological Inquiry

notes.note: Register for either lecture 1 or 2 (whichever has room). Both sections are the same.
Please note: 4-credit option is offered only for the Writing in the Majors component of COGST 1101 (inc. PSYCH 1102, LING 1170, PHIL 1910, CS 1710).
No prerequisties. May be used to satisfy the psychology major, breadth requirement and alternative prerequisite for biopsychology courses.
Prerequisites: BIONB 2220 or permission of instructor. 3 or 4 credits. 4 credits includes lab.

course.subject: PSYCH
course.course_title: Human Perception: Applications to Computer Graphics, Art, and Visual Display

notes.note: 3 or 4 credits; 4-credit option involves term paper. Highly recommended: PSYCH 2050
Prerequisite: senior standing or permission of instructor.
Prerequisites: open to junior and senior psychology majors and to graduate students; open to other by permission.

course.subject: PSYCH
course.course_title: Effects of Aging on Sensory and Perceptual Systems

notes.note: Prerequisites: introductory course in biology or psychology, plus second course in perception, neuroscience, cognitive science, or biopsychology. Four credit option involves term paper or relevant web site. This course will be taught using the Socratic Method, in which the instructor asks questions-student responses will be made using Clickers, which will be used for responses to questions and ntr for attendance or grading.
Prerequisites: introductory biology and course in neurobiology and behavior or biopsychology or 3000- level course in biopsychology or permission of instructor.
Prerequisite: Psych 2090 or HD 1150. By application. Co-meets with 6650. Open to graduate students and advances undergraduates (junior or senior).
